title: Drawing, ca. 1770
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, black chalk traces on white laid paper
markings: Stamps: Lower right corner, George Guy, Fourth Earl of Warwick (Lugt 2600)
provenance:
Unknown English (?) collection (sale, lot 22, according to indications on verso of drawing); George Guy, Fourth Earl of Warwick (Lugt 2600) (sale London, Christie's, 17 July 1896, lot no. 164), as Francesco Guardi
Raimundo De Madrazo
Miss Sarah Hewitt
description: A view of a waterway with a ruined structure on a small promentory and surrounded by various figures, enclosed in a central escutcheon with assymetrical side panels.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, ca. 1770.
ca. 1770. Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, black chalk traces on white laid paper. Bequest of Erskine Hewitt. 1938-57-242.
